Comment.
Nazeris minor
was originally described from "Tienmuschan, Nordwestliches China", which actually located in northwest Zhejiang Province, east China.
Nazeris nigritulus
was described from "Tianmushan", the same locality of
N. minor
. An examination of the types revealed that the latter species is undoubtedly a new synonym of
N. minor .

Comparative notes.
Nazeris minor
is highly similar to
N. cultellatus
Assing, 2013
in external and male sexual characters, but can be separated by denser punctation of the abdomen and the shorter dorso-lateral apophyses of the aedeagus ( Figs. 3, 4 ).

Distribution and habitat data. The species is known from three adjacent mountains in northwest Zhejiang . The specimens were collected by sifting leaf litter at altitudes of 500–1500 m , always together with
N. chinensis
and
N. rougemonti
.
